source: On their way home to defend the Empire, the crew of Lutius was surprised by the will of the gods.
target: Le toil nan diathan, thàinig cnap-starra eile ann an rathad sgioba Lutius mus do thill iad dhachaigh gus an Ìmpireachd a dhìon.

source: The message was addressed to me, begging me to come back to Fremil. It says that the Empire is at war with the Barbarians. They were attacked from the north by the tribe that I was forbidden to attack. It is clear to me what I must do…
target: Chaidh an teachdaireachd a chur thugamsa, a’ guidhe gun tillinn gu Fremil. Tha i ag ràdh gu bheil an Ìmpireachd a’ cogadh ris na Tùsanaich. Chaidh ionnsaigh a thoirt orra on taobh tuath leis an treubh nach d’ fhuair mi cead gus ionnsaigh a thoirt orra. Tha e follaiseach dè dh’fheumas mi dèanamh a-nis…

source: I really don’t know if and how we will get back home. And the war is going on without us. I hope my fellow soldiers are defending our empire well.
target: Chan eil for agam air ciamar a thilleas sinn dhachaigh idir a-nis. Agus tha an cogadh a’ dol air adhart às ar n-aonais. Tha mi ’n dòchas gun dìon ar co-shaighdearan ar n-Ìmpireachd gu math.

source: Yes my fellow soldiers, we have done it! We have met all the challenges that were put in front of us. But my heart is still with our home. We shall set sail as soon as possible to help defend the Empire from the Barbarian tribe.
target: Shoirbhich leinn, a chàirdean! Seas sinn an aghaidh nan dùbhlan uile a bha romhainn. Gidheadh, tha an cianalas orm. Bheir sinn an cuan oirnn cho luath ’s a ghabhas ach an dìonamaid ar n-Ìmpireachd an aghaidh treubh nan Tùsanach.

source: Furthermore, we will have to live with the guilt of destroying a temple of an Empire goddess on our souls.
target: A bharrachd air sin, ’s ann air ar n-anman-ne a tha an cionta a-nis gun do mhill sinn teampall ban-dia na h-Ìmpireachd.

source: Defeat the Barbarians and the Empire Colony
target: Cuir ruaig air na Tùsanaich ’s air tuineachadh na h-Ìmpireachd

source: The Barbarians and the Empire are too dangerous to allow them to live near us. We must defeat them both.
target: Tha na Tùsanaich ’s an Ìmpireachd ro chunnartach ach am faod sinn am fulang faisg oirnn. Feumaidh sinn ruaig a chur air an dà chuid dhiubh.

source: Strangers! I, Murilius, Proconsul of the Northern Lands, a province of the Empire, demand to know who you are and what business you have in these lands!
target: A choigrich! Tha mise, Murilius, Proconsul nan Tìrean Tuathach, mòr-roinn na h-Ìmpireachd, ag iarraidh oirbh gun innis sibh dhomh cò sibhse is dè tha sibh ris san dùthaich seo!

source: If you seek to live peacefully here, you are not faced with a choice whether to allow them to live here – you are required to assist the Empire in driving them out.
target: Ma tha thu a’ guidhe gu bheil sibh a’ sireadh beatha sìtheil, chan eil roghainn eile agaibh ach am fuadach-san – tha sibh fo dhleastanas taic a chur ris an Ìmpireachd ach am faigheamaid cuidhteas dhiubh.

source: Also, as a sign of your good intentions, we demand a gift of friendship to the Empire. As you should have noticed, I have presented you with a new warehouse. Fill it with the required gifts to hand them over. I permit you to give us these wares:
target: Cuideachd, mar fhianais air ur deagh-rùn, tha sinn ag iarraidh tìodhlac càirdeis don Ìmpireachd uaibh. Mar a mhothaich thu gun teagamh, thug mi taigh-stòrais ùr dhuibh. Lìonaibh dhomh e leis na dh’iarras mi oirbh. Leigidh mi leibh na batharan seo a thoirt dhuinn:

source: Chieftain Reebaud – the demands of this arrogant Empire Proconsul are just outrageous. He treats us like we are his servants. And we certainly cannot afford to spare that many wares to aid him. I propose that we destroy that ugly warehouse and let him fight his own battles.
target: A cheannaird Reebauid – tha iarrtasan Proconsul àrdanach na h-Ìmpireachd tàmailteach. Tha e a’ dèanamh rinn mar shearbhantan. Agus chan eil an uiread a bhathair againn a tha e ag iarraidh uainn mar cuideachadh. Mholainn gum mill sinn an taigh-stòrais grànnda ud is gun dèanadh esan an t-sabaid aige fhèin.

source: If you fail to deliver these wares, the Empire shall treat you like enemies. And so as to prevent you wasting your precious metal, I forbid you to expand your territory from this moment on until you have given us your gift. Fail to obey, and the Empire shall treat you like enemies.
target: Mura doir sibh na batharan seo dhuinn, làimhsichidh an Ìmpireachd sibh mar nàimhdean. Agus a chùm nach dèan sibh caitheamh air a’ mheatailt phrìseil agaibh, tha mi a’ toirmeasg gun leudaicheadh sibh ur ranntair o seo a-mach gus am bi sinn air tìodhlac fhaighinn uaibh. Mura doir sibh ùmhlachd dhuinn, làimhsichidh an Ìmpireachd sibh mar nàimhdean.

source: You will have to fight those barbarians if you intend to live in the area; surely you can see that fighting them together with the Empire is easier than alone? And you really do not want the Empire as your enemy. Barbarians though you are, I do believe you will realize the truth of my words after some consideration.
target: Feumaidh sibh sabaid an aghaidh an t-sluaigh bhuirb ud co-dhiù ma tha sibh airson fuireach san sgìre; bu chòir thu tuigsinn gum biodh e na b’ fhasa sabaid ’nan aghaidh còmhla ris an Ìmpireachd na ’nur n-aonar. Agus chan eil thu ag iarraidh an Ìmpireachd ’na nàmhaid dhuibh. Ged nach e ach daoine borba a th’ annaibh, cha chreid mi nach tuig sibh gu bheil an fhìrinn agam ma nì sibh cnuasadh air.

source: The Empire is Angry
target: Tha an Ìmpireachd feargach

source: You are enemies of the Empire, and I shall treat you as such!
target: ’S e nàimhdean na h-Ìmpireachd a th’ annaibh is làimhsichidh sinn dha rèir sibh!

source: The Empire is Grateful
target: Tha an Ìmpireachd taingeil

source: Strangers! I see you have kept your word. The Empire rewards its friends, therefore I shall reward you with the friendship of the Empire!
target: A choigrichibh! Mhothaich mi gum b’ fhiach ur facal. Bheir an Ìmpireachd duais do a caraidean agus le sin bheir mi càirdeas na h-Ìmpireachd mar dhuais dhuibh!

source: Did I understand him correctly? After all we have done for him, after so many of my soldiers have laid down their lives for his sake, he wants us to be servants of this Empire, and take away my leadership? And does the hypocrite dare call this a reward?
target: B’ àill leibh? Às dèidh a h-uile càil a rinn sinn às a leth agus tuilleadh ’s a chòrr de na saighdearan agam ’nan sìneadh air a’ bhlàr dhasan, ’s ann gu bheil e ag iarraidh gun rachadh sinn ’nar searbhantan dhan Ìmpireachd a tha seo ’s esan airson mo rìoghachd a thoirt uam? Agus ghabh an cealgair air gur e duais a bhiodh ann!

source: In this game, you start out on a small piece of land with just a few resources. Using these, you’ll create an empire with many thousands of inhabitants. On your way towards this goal, you will have to establish an economic infrastructure, explore the land around you and face rivaling tribes.
target: Tòisichidh tu le cnap tìre beag le stòras beag sa gheama seo. Cruthaichidh tu ìmpireachd le mìltean dhe shaoranaich asta. Feumaidh tu bun-structar an eaconamaidh a stèidheachadh, an tìr timcheall ort a rùrachadh agus strì an aghaidh threubhan eile gus an t-amas seo a choileanadh.

source: The Empire produces granite blocks in quarries and marble mines.
target: Nì an Ìmpireachd blocan gaireil sna cuaraidhean is mèinnean marmoir.

source: Besides bread and meat, fish is also a foodstuff for the Empire. Fish are used in taverns, inns and training sites (arena, colosseum, training camp).
target: A bharrachd air aran is feòil, is na h-èisg biadh eile airson na h-Ìmpireachd. Cleachdaidh na taighean-tàirn, taighean-òil is ionadan–oideachaidh (raointean spòrs, coileasaman is campaichean oideachaidh) iad.

source: Flour is produced by the mill out of wheat and is needed in the bakery to produce the tasty Empire bread.
target: Thèid flùr a shaothrachadh de chruithneachd sa mhuileann. Cleachdaidh tu ann an taighean-fuine e gus an t-aran blasta aig muinntir na h-Ìmpireachd a dhèanamh.

source: The bakers of the Empire make really tasty bread out of flour and water. It is used in taverns and inns to prepare rations and meals. Bread is also consumed at the training sites (arena, colosseum, training camp).
target: Nì fuineadairean na h-Ìmpireachd aran uabhasach blasta à flùr is uisge. Cleachdaidh na taighean-tàirn is taighean-òil e gus greimeagan is miasan ullachadh. Ithear e ann an ionadan-oideachaidh (raointean spòrs, coileasaman is campaichean oideachaidh) cuideachd.

source: Marble columns represent the high culture of the Empire, so they are needed for nearly every larger building. They are produced out of marble at a stonemason’s house.
target: Riochdaichidh colbhan marmoir àrd-chultar na h-Ìmpireachd, mar sin bidh feum orra airson a’ mhòrchuid de na togalaichean mòra. Thèid an saothrachadh à marmor ann an taigh clachair.

source: The fires of the Empire smelting works, armor smithies and weapon smithies are usually fed with coal.
target: Thèid teintean aig ceàrdach leaghadair, ceàrdach armachd is ceàrdach arm na h-Ìmpireachd a bhiadhadh le gual mar as trice.

source: This wooden spear is the basic weapon in the Empire military system. It is produced in the weapon smithy. In combination with a helmet, it is the equipment to fit out young soldiers.
target: ’S e an t-arm bunasach ann an siostam arm na h-Ìmpireachd a th’ anns an t-sleagh fiodha. Thèid a shaothrachadh ann an ceàrdach arm. Beiridh gach saighdear òg tè is clogaid.

source: This is the best and sharpest weapon the Empire weaponsmith creates for the soldiers. It is used in the training camp – together with food – to train soldiers from attack level 3 to level 4.
target: Seo an t-arm as fheàrr is as gèire a nì airm-chiùird na h-Ìmpireachd airson nan saighdearan. Thèid a chleachdadh sa champa oideachaidh – le biadh – gus ionnsaigh nan saighdearan oideachadh o leibheil 3 gu leibheil 4.

source: Basic armor for Empire soldiers. It is produced in the armor smithy and used in the training camp – together with food – to train soldiers from health level 1 to level 2.
target: Seo armachd bhunasach aig saighdearan na h-Ìmpireachd. Saothraichidh tu ann an ceàrdach armachd i is thèid a cleachdadh sa champa oideachaidh – le biadh – gus slàinte nan saighdearan oideachadh o leibheil 1 gu leibheil 2.

source: The chain armor is a medium armor for Empire soldiers. It is produced in an armor smithy and used in a training camp – together with food – to train soldiers from health level 2 to level 3.
target: ’S e armachd mheadhanach aig saighdearan na h-Ìmpireachd a th’ anns a mhàilleach. Saothraichidh tu ann an ceàrdach armachd i is thèid a cleachdadh sa champa oideachaidh – le biadh – gus slàinte nan saighdearan oideachadh o leibheil 2 gu leibheil 3.

source: The gilded armor is the strongest armor an Empire soldier can have. It is produced in the armor smithy and used in the training camp – together with food – to train soldiers from health level 3 to level 4.
target: ’S e an armachd as treasa aig saighdearan na h-Ìmpireachd a th’ anns an lùireach òraichte. Saothraichidh tu ann an ceàrdach armachd i is thèid a cleachdadh sa champa oideachaidh – le biadh – gus slàinte nan saighdearan oideachadh o leibheil 3 gu leibheil 4.

source: Defeat Erwyn. He commands the strongest opposing military force left on this island.
target: Cuir ruaig air Erwyn. Tha am feachd as treasa fo a smachd a tha air fhàgail air an eilean seo.

source: We found one more building of this strange making. We have yet to see any of its builders. But obviously there has been a community on this island before and obviously it was militarized. I have to check on our military status with my generals. I will not allow that a potential enemy will find us unprepared.
target: Lorg sinn fear eile de na togalaichean neònach ud. Chan eil sgeul air na daoine a thog iad fhathast. Ach bha coimhearsnachd san eilean seo roimhe gun teagamh agus tha e follaiseach gun robh feachd aca. Feumaidh mi bruidhinn ris na cinn-armailt agam a thaobh cor an fheachd againn. Cha cheadaich mi gun dig nàmhaid oirnn ma dh’fhaoidte is sinn gun uallachadh.

source: Sire, we do not know anything about the island. And I believe we are not safe either. It would probably be reasonable to build a tower to explore the island and add some military strength.
target: A thighearna, tha sinn gu tur aineolach mun eilean seo. Agus saoilidh mi nach eil sinn sàbhailte idir. Bhiodh e gu feum dhuinn gun teagamh nan togamaid tùr gus an t-eilean a rùrachadh agus an arm againn a neartachadh.

source: Sire, Amalea is right about the resources. Therefore I correct myself. We should only build an outpost as this is the most effective military building.
target: A thighearna, tha Amalea ceart a thaobh nan stòrasan. Mar sin, mholainn rud eile dhuibh. Cha bu chòir dhuinn togail ach gearastan on as e an togalach as èifeachdaiche a th’ ann dhan arm.

source: Sire, today we got a lot closer to finally returning home again. Our military has spotted a space to build a port on. We should start to build a port quickly.
target: A thighearna, saoilidh mi gun do lorg sinn dòigh airson tilleadh dhachaigh. Thachair an t-arm againn ri àite airson port a thogail air. Bu chòir dhuinn tòiseachadh air port a thogail cho luath ’s a ghabhas.

source: Increase your military strength by training your soldiers
target: Cuir ri neart an fheachd agad le oideachadh nan saighdearan agad

source: You need to increase your military strength.
target: Feumaidh tu am feachd agad a neartachadh.

source: Sire, it is really a great pleasure to be at home again. And best of all: I can see we still have some military strength. I can count five towers and a fortress in our vicinity to guard us.
target: A thighearna, ’s e toileachas mòr a th’ ann dhomh gu bheil sinn aig an taigh a-rithist. Agus nas feàrr buileach: Mhothaich mi gu bheil neart airm againn fhathast. Chì mi còig tùir agus dùn am fagas a dhìonas sinn.

source: We Could Use The Military Instead
target: B’ urrainn dhuinn an t-arm a chleachdadh ’na àite

source: I am really worried about the weakness of our army. We should start to increase our military power. As a starting point, we should recruit at least ten new soldiers.
target: Tha dragh mòr orm mu laigse ar n-arm. Bu chòir dhuinn cur ri neart. Mar thoiseach-tòiseachaidh, bu chòir dhuinn deichnear shaighdearan ùra a thrusadh air a char as lugha.

source: Now we can really improve our army and build the military strength that we will need to defend our country.
target: ’S urrainn dhuinn piseach mòr a thoirt air ar n-arm a-nis agus a neartachadh ach an dìonamaid ar dùthaich.

source: We should also build other related buildings nearby, such as a furnace, and some wells and farms to supply the reindeer farm. This design will make our military economy more efficient, because it reduces the waiting time for wares in the processing buildings.
target: Bu chòir dhuinn togalaichean co-cheangailte eile a thogail am fagas, can fùirneis agus tobraichean is tuathanasan a bheir batharan dhan tuathanas rèin-fhèidh. Nì an dealbhachadh seo an eaconamaidh againn nas èifeachdaiche dhan arm againn o nach fheum na togalaichean feitheamh airson batharan ro fhada.

source: Your soldiers will leave the fortress while the construction is going on. This means that your fortress will lose its military influence, as I described above.
target: Fàgaidh na saighdearan agad an dùn fad ’s a tha an togail a’ dol air adhart. Is ciall dha seo gun caill an dùn a bhuaidh air an ranntair mar a mhìnich mi gu h-àrd.

source: This spear is the basic weapon in the Amazon military system. It is produced by the stone carver. In combination with a tunic, it is the equipment to fit out young soldiers.
target: ’S e an t-arm bunasach ann an siostam arm na h-Amasoin a th’ anns an t-sleagh. Thèid a shaothrachadh le snaidheadair. Beiridh gach bana-ghaisgeach òg tè is earrasaid.

source: This is the most dangerous weapon of the Atlantean military. Only the best of the best soldiers may use it. It is produced in the weapon smithy and used in the dungeon – together with food – to train soldiers from attack level 3 to level 4.
target: Seo an t-arm as cunnartaiche aig feachd nan Atlantach. Chan fhaod ach fìor-ghaisgich a chleachdadh. Saothraichidh tu sa cheàrdach arm i is thèid a cleachdadh san toll-dubh – le biadh – gus ionnsaigh nan saighdearan oideachadh o leibheil 3 gu leibheil 4.

source:
Berthron, chief military adviser of Chat’Karuth,
when they lost the headquarters in the battle around the heights of Kal’Megarath
target:
Bearthron,
prìomh comhairle airm Chat’Charuid,
nuair a chiall iad am prìomh-àras ann am blàr Àird Chal’meagaraid

source:
Berthron,
chief military adviser of Chat’Karuth
target:
Bearthron,
prìomh comhairle airm Chat’Charuid

source: This wooden spear is the basic weapon in the Empire military system. It is produced in the weapon smithy. In combination with a helmet, it is the equipment to fit out young soldiers.
target: ’S e an t-arm bunasach ann an siostam arm na h-Ìmpireachd a th’ anns an t-sleagh fiodha. Thèid a shaothrachadh ann an ceàrdach arm. Beiridh gach saighdear òg tè is clogaid.

source: The initial setting depends on the type of the building. For the Barbarians, the sentry is the only building that prefers rookies by default. You should change this setting to fit your current needs.
target: Tha an roghainn bhunaiteach a-rèir seòrsa gach togalaich. Airson nan Tùsanach, ’s e am freiceadan a tha san aon togalach as fheàrr leis saighdearan ùra a ghnàth. Bu chòir dhut an roghainn seo atharrachadh a-rèir an t-suidheachaidh sa bheil thu.

source: An example: the default value for scythes is 1. If you build a farm, a carrier will take a scythe and become a farmer. Then there will be no scythes left, but the target quantity is 1, therefore your toolsmith will start producing another one.
target: Seo eisimpleir: ’s e 1 a tha san luach bhunaiteach airson fàil. Ma thogas tu tuathanas, gabhaidh giùlanair greim air fàl ach an dèid e ’na thuathanach. Cha bhi fàl air fhàgail dhut an uairsin ach ’s e 1 a th’ anns an uiread-amais, mar sin tòisichidh an ceàrd air fear eile a dhèanamh.

source: If you do not set water and fish resources, a default amount will be used.
target: Mura suidhich thu stòras uisge no iasg, thèid uiread bunaiteach a chleachdadh.

source: The default profile cannot be overwritten
target: Cha ghabh sgrìobhadh thairis air a’ phròifil bunaiteach

source: We offer to also produce the tabards for young soldiers and the golden tabards for officers for you in exchange. You will need them for sure as soon as you want to recruit new soldiers.
target: Tha sinn a’ tabhann cuideachd gun dèan sinn lèintean dha na saighdearan òga agus lèintean òrach dha na seann-ghaisgich mar taing dhuibh. Bidh feum agaibh orra gun teagamh on a bhios sibh airson saighdearan ùra a thrusadh.

source: I am really worried about the weakness of our army. We should start to increase our military power. As a starting point, we should recruit at least ten new soldiers.
target: Tha dragh mòr orm mu laigse ar n-arm. Bu chòir dhuinn cur ri neart. Mar thoiseach-tòiseachaidh, bu chòir dhuinn deichnear shaighdearan ùra a thrusadh air a char as lugha.

source: Expanding would also provide more space for farming. We could use some extra barley to recruit more reindeer, as our roads are quite busy.
target: Bheireadh leudachadh barrachd rùim dhuinn airson àiteachas cuideachd. Bhiodh barrachd eòrna ’na buannachd dhuinn ach an trusamaid barrachd rèin-fhèidh on a tha na rathaidean againn caran trang.

source: Look up which wares are needed to recruit soldiers
target: Dèan rannsachadh air na batharan a dh’fheumas tu airson saighdearan a thrusadh

source: You have closed the encyclopedia window, but I didn’t notice that you were trying to find out which wares are needed to recruit a soldier. Would you please reopen it and do so?
target: Tha thu air uinneag an leabhair-eòlais a dhùnadh ach cha do mhothaich mi gun robh thu a’ feuchainn ri faighinn a-mach dè na batharan a dh’fheumas tu airson saighdear a thrusadh. Am fosgail thu a-rithist i airson sin a dhèanamh?

source: The barracks needs %s on average to recruit one soldier.
target: Bheir an taigh-feachd %s sa chuibheas gus saighdear a thrusadh.

source: Fish is one of the two major food resources of the Amazons. It is used by the food preserver to prepare rations for the workers digging for gold dust and granite. It is also consumed at the training sites (training glade and warriors’ gathering) and for recruiting new soldiers.
target: ’S e fear dhen dà stòras bìdh cudromach do Mhuinntir na h-Amasoin a tha san iasg. Cleachdaidh an grèidheadh bìdh e airson greimeagan ullachadh dhan luchd-obrach a bhios a’ tochladh mìrean òir is gaireal. Thèid a chleachdadh sna h-ionadan-oideachaidh cuideachd (blàran-coille ’s tionail nam bana-ghaisgeach) airson saighdearan ùra a thrusadh.

source: Lutius. I really appreciate that you and Saledus are so concerned about our security. But I think we could use the little space on this island better than by building a lot of military buildings.
target: A Lutius. Gach moladh dhut agus a Shaledus gu bheil sibh iomagaineach mu ar tèarainteachd. Ach saoilidh mi gum bu chòir dhuinn am beagan àite a th’ againn san eilean a cleachdadh air dòigh nas fheàrr seach a bhith a’ togail an t-uabhas de thogalaichean an airm.

source: Some say that impenetrable lands to the far north scared away even the most courageous settlers and the bravest of the brave warriors. Big and old forests, full of big and predatory game, cut across by wetlands and hills were shrouded in mystery. The ones who had managed to come back mentioned tremendous buildings, decorated with carvings and gold from majestic mountain ranges somewhere amongst the wilderness. Dozens of years after only some crumbly ruins remain of these good old times, covered with moss and trees. Their shapes give only an idea about the craftsmanship of ancient constructors. Nobody knows why they (have) disappeared. Nobody knows why. People say that now nothing is blocking the road to wealth. But many will die pulled apart by wolves, engulfed by swamp… encircled by hostile tribes.
target: Tha cuid ag ràdh gun do chum an tìr dho-inntrig fada tuath fiù ’s an luchd-tuineachaidh ’s na gaisgich as dàna air falbh. ’S e seann choilltean mòra dìomhair a bh’ ann làn bheathaichean sealgair mòra eadar talamh fliuch ’s cnuic. Dh’innseadh an fheadhainn a thill beò às mu thogalaichean mòra le sgeadachadh snaidhte ’s òir orra agus gun dàinig an t-òr à monaidhean àite air choireigin san fhàsach. Bliadhnaichean mòra às dèidh seo, chan eil ach fuighill còmhdaichte le còinneach ’s craobhan air fhàgail dhen bheatha mhath a b’ àbhaist a bhith ann. Cha doir an cruthan ach beachd farsaing dhut mu cheàird an luchd-togail àrsaidh. Chan eil fios aig duine carson a dh’fhalbh iad. Chan eil fios aig duine carson. Thathar ag ràdh nach eil dad a’ bacadh an rathad dhan bheairteas a-nis. Ach gheibh mòran dhiubh bàs air an reubadh le madaidhean-allaidh, air an dol fodha ann am boglach… le treubhan nàimhdeil timcheall orra.

source: This is good news indeed, Opol. Our economy is developing very well. Go back to your work now, Opol, and may Satul warm you and all your guild members!
target: Seo deagh naidheachd dha-rìribh, Opol. Tha an eaconamaidh againn a’ fàs glè mhath. Till don obair agad a-nis, Opol agus gum blàthaicheadh Satul thu agus gach bhall de chomann nam breabadair!

source: Only the gods know for how long we have to remain hidden here. The warriors hope we may march back gloriously any day now, but I strongly doubt that will happen soon. And the days are short and cold…
target: Chan eil fios aig na diathan dè cho fada ’s a dh’fheumas sinn fuireach ’nar falach ann a sheo. Tha na gaisgich an dòchas nach bi e fada gus an dèid leinn tilleadh ’s gus an dèan sinn a’ chùis air an nàmhaid, ach tha mi fhìn fo amharas nach tachair seo a dh’aithghearr. Agus tha na làithean air am fàs goirid is fuair oirnn…

source: But never forget – these forests are our heritage, entrusted upon us by our ancestors. We must always respect and care for them. What we take, we must give back again.
target: Ach cuimhnichibh oirbh – is ar dìleab a tha sna coilltean seo a dh’earb ar sinnsearan rinn. Feumaidh sinn urram ’s cùram a thoirt dhaibh an-còmhnaidh. Feumaidh sinn tilleadh na thog sinn.

source: The BASTARD! Only one man of our frontier patrol came back alive. He carried a message from Kalitath, telling us that he will punish every move of our troops with their own blood! We cannot accept this behavior. From now on, there is war between Kalitath and us!
target: An cù! Cha do thill ach aonar dhe na ceathrar chuairteachan on chrìoch. Thug e teachdaireachd o Khalitath dhuinn ag innse gum bi e a’ peanasachadh gach gluasad dhen fheachd againn leis an fhuil aca fhèin! Chan urrainn dhuinn gabhail ris a’ ghiùlan seo. O seo a-mach, gum biodh an cogadh eadarainn is Kalitath!

source: This morning, I found Thron’s mind troubled. He returned from his patrol late last night and sat back against a tree, watching over the encampment. The number of quarrels and disputes keeps growing, and the winter has us firmly in its grip. We should put food in our storage to survive the long, cold winter!
target: Sa mhadainn an-diugh, mhothaich mi gun robh an t-iomagan air Tron. Thill e anmoch on chuairt a-raoir is shuidh e ri craobh, a’ coimhead air a’ champachadh. Tha an trod ’s an connsachadh a’ dol am miosad agus tha sinn fo bhuaidh a’ gheamhraidh chruaidh. Bu chòir dhuinn stòras bìdh a chruinneachadh ach am mair sinn beò tron gheamhradh fhada fhuar!

source: At first, I was naive and hoped that they were peaceful, but as soon as one of them saw me, they charged towards me and started attacking me with their throwing spears. Thanks be to the Gods that I was able to flee and hide myself, before retreating back to our colony under cover of darkness.
target: Nach mise a bha gorm aig an toiseach ’s làn dòchais gum biodh iad sìtheil ach cho luath ’s a mhothaich iad dhomh, ghabh iad orm leis na sleaghan tilgeil aca. Taing do na diathan gun deach leam teicheadh agus m’ fhalach mus do chùlaich mi don tuineachadh againn air an oidhche.

source: There are still a few Barbarians hiding on our island, but I am sure that we will find them soon. Every Barbarian who doesn’t attack us will be put in a boat with the other peaceful ones, and sent back to their country.
target: Tha cuid de na Tùsanaich nam falach san eilean againn fhathast, ach tha mi cinnteach gun lorg sinn iad a dh’aithghearr. Thèid gach Tùsanach a bheir ionnsaigh oirnn a chur air bàta leis an fheadhainn sìtheil eile agus a thilleadh don dùthaich aca fhèin.

source: Today a pigeon landed on our island. It brought a message which fills me with dark thoughts and brings back my fears.
target: Thàinig calman don eilean againn an-diugh. Thug e naidheachd dhuinn a chuir an leann-dubh ’s an t-eagal orm.

source: The message was addressed to me, begging me to come back to Fremil. It says that the Empire is at war with the Barbarians. They were attacked from the north by the tribe that I was forbidden to attack. It is clear to me what I must do…
target: Chaidh an teachdaireachd a chur thugamsa, a’ guidhe gun tillinn gu Fremil. Tha i ag ràdh gu bheil an Ìmpireachd a’ cogadh ris na Tùsanaich. Chaidh ionnsaigh a thoirt orra on taobh tuath leis an treubh nach d’ fhuair mi cead gus ionnsaigh a thoirt orra. Tha e follaiseach dè dh’fheumas mi dèanamh a-nis…

source: I really don’t know if and how we will get back home. And the war is going on without us. I hope my fellow soldiers are defending our empire well.
target: Chan eil for agam air ciamar a thilleas sinn dhachaigh idir a-nis. Agus tha an cogadh a’ dol air adhart às ar n-aonais. Tha mi ’n dòchas gun dìon ar co-shaighdearan ar n-Ìmpireachd gu math.

source: First, we need to find some more resources to back up our growing economy. I have spotted an island with some mountains in the south. Perhaps we can find some valuable resources like iron there.
target: Feumaidh sinn barrachd stòrasan a lorg an toiseach ach an cuidich seo an eaconamaidh againn. Chunnaic mi eilean gu deas oirnn anns a bheil beanntan. ’S dòcha gun lorg sinn stòrasan prìseil mar iarann annta.

source: Ave, Sire! The people and me are so glad to see you returning back home. We really need some good leadership around here.
target: Ave, a thighearna! Tha an sluagh agus mi fhìn glè thoilichte gun do thill sibh dhachaigh. Tha cruaidh-fheum againn air deagh-stiùireadh.

source: Alright Lutius, another problem solved. Still more to come. As we are able to produce food now, we should start mining some coal and iron ore immediately. After all, we need more tools to get our economy back up and build more and different production sites.
target: Sin sin, a Lutius, dh’fhuasgail sinn dùbhlan eile. Bidh barrachd dhiubh romhainn gun teagamh. On as urrainn dhuinn biadh a shaothrachadh a-nis, bu chòir dhuinn tòiseachadh air gual is clach-iarainn a thochladh sa bhad. Air deireadh an latha, tha barrachd acainnean a dhìth oirnn ach an leudaich ’s leasaich sinn an eaconamaidh againn le caochladh thogalaichean ùra.

source: I would say that three fully trained heroes should be sufficient to begin with. But don’t forget to send them to the front line, because they are not that useful back home.
target: Saoilidh mi gum foghainn triùir shaighdearan air an làn-oideachadh an toiseach. Ach thoir an aire gun cuir thu dhan bheulaibh iad o nach bi iad glè fheumail aig an taigh.

source: I have seen some advanced weapons in our warehouses. Perhaps it would be possible to smelt them back into metal? But that seems like a waste of the precious swords…
target: Mhothaich mi do dh’airm adhartach sna taighean-stòrais againn. ’S dòcha gun gabhadh an leagadh ’nam meatailt? Ach dhomhsa dheth, ’s e call chlaidheamhan uasail a bhiodh ann…

source: You can also reload the game from a previous savegame. Luckily, these are created from time to time. To do so, you will have to go back to the main menu and choose ‘Single Player’ → ‘Load Game’. And please be a bit more careful next time.
target: Mar roghainn eile, ’s urrainn dhut an geama a luchdadh às ùr o gheama air a shàbhaladh. Gu fortanach, cruthaichidh sinn fear dhut o àm gu àm. Gus geama a luchdadh, feumaidh tu tilleadh dhan phrìomh chlàr-taice agus “Aon chluicheadair” → “Luchdaich geama” a thaghadh an uairsin. Agus nach bi thu nas fhaiceallaiche an ath thuras?

source: Well done. Now you know how to draw back your soldiers from the places where you don’t need them. It is time to tell you how to reinforce your front line.
target: Sin thu. Tha fios agad a-nis mar a bheir thu na saighdearan agad air falbh o na h-àiteachan far nach eil feum agad orra. Innsidh mi dhut a-nis mar a chuireas tu foirlionadh gu far a bheil an t-sabaid.

source: When you have seen enough, switch back to the third tab (‘Wares in warehouses’).
target: Nuair a bhios tu air do leòr fhaicinn, till dhan treas taba. (“Bathar ann an taighean-stòrais”).

source: The stonemason pauses %s before going back to work again.
target: Gabhaidh an clachair fois fad %s mus tòisich e air an obair a-rithist.

source: This light wooden armor is a basic piece of armor for the Amazons’ soldiers. It is produced by a dressmaker and used in a training glade – together with food – to train soldiers from health level 0 to level 1.
target: ’S e armachd bhunasach aig bana-ghaisgich na h-Amasoin a th’ anns an armachd fhiodha aotrom seo. Saothraichidh tu ann an ceàrdach dhreasaichean i is thèid a cleachdadh sa bhlàran-coille – le biadh – gus slàinte nan gaisgeach oideachadh o leibheil 0 gu leibheil 1.

source: Only a small hill in the centre of the map connects these four competing tribes. Lead your army to this hill right away and build a giant stronghold as a sign of your superiority!
target: Cha cheangal ach cnocan ann am meadhan a’ mhapa na ceithir treubhan seo a tha a’ strì an aghaidh càch a chèile. Stiùirich am feachd agad dhan chnocan ud sa bhad ’s tog dùn mòr mar shanas air do cheannas!

source: Now try this out. A small dot in green, yellow, or red tells you whether the item has arrived, is on its way or is not available respectively.
target: Nise, feuch e. Innsidh dotag uaine, bhuidhe no dhearg ge b’ e a bheil an nì air a thighinn, air an t-slighe no gun fhaighinn fhathast.

source: A tavern opened for our people yesterday. While I am hardly in the mood for celebration, I noticed how much this tiny bit of home means to my people. Their songs filled the air until deep in the night, and they were in higher spirits still the day after.
target: Dh’fhosgail taigh-tàirn airson ar muinntir an-dè. Ged nach eil subhachas air m’ aire, mhothaich mi dè cho cudromach ’s a tha seòrsa de dhachaigh dha mo mhuinntir. Ghabh iad òrain gu anmoch air an oidhche agus bha iad ann an deagh shunnd an làrna-mhàireach fhathast.

source: This light wooden armor is a basic piece of armor for the Amazons’ soldiers. It is produced by a dressmaker and used in a training glade – together with food – to train soldiers from health level 0 to level 1.
target: ’S e armachd bhunasach aig bana-ghaisgich na h-Amasoin a th’ anns an armachd fhiodha aotrom seo. Saothraichidh tu ann an ceàrdach dhreasaichean i is thèid a cleachdadh sa bhlàran-coille – le biadh – gus slàinte nan gaisgeach oideachadh o leibheil 0 gu leibheil 1.

source: We need to find a nice place for the lumberjack’s hut. To make this easier, we can activate ‘Show Building Spaces’.
target: Feumaidh sinn àite ghoireasach a lorg airson bothan a’ choillteir. Seallamaid na h-ionadan togail gus seo a dhèanamh nas fhasa.

source: The hunter-gatherer working out of this hunter-gatherer’s hut can’t find any game or fish in her work area.
target: Cha do lorg an sealgair ’s cruinniche a tha ag obair aig a’ bhothan seo iasg no sitheann sam bith taobh a-staigh an raoin-obrach tuilleadh.

source: The stonecutter working at this stonecutter’s hut can’t find any rocks in her work area.
target: Chan urrainn dhan tochailtear a tha ag obair aig a’ bhothan tochailteir seo carraig a lorg taobh a-staigh an raoin-obrach tuilleadh.

source: You need to connect this flag to a scout’s hut before you can send a scout here.
target: Feumaidh tu a’ bhratach seo a cheangal ri bothan rabhadair mus urrainn dhut rabhadair a chur an-seo.

source: And if your waterways present a significant shortcut between your road networks, your economy will tend to send many wares over the waterway. As a waterway can hold only one ferry – unlike roads, which receive a second carrier if they are very busy –, and as they often tend to be rather longer than the two or three fields recommended for roads, there is always a risk of waterways becoming severe bottlenecks in your economy. Try to build several of them in parallel to distribute the strain. If this is not possible, it is in some cases even more efficient not to use waterways.
target: Agus ma bhios na slighean aiseig agad mòran nas giorra na na rathaidean agad, cuiridh an eaconamaidh tòrr bhatharan tromhpa. Air sgàth ’s nach eil ach aon bhàta-aiseig aig gach slighe aiseig – eucoltach ri rathaidean aig a bheil dithis ma tha iad glè thrang – agus on a bhios iad a’ sìneadh nas fhaide eadar nam bratach na bhios rathaidean mar as trice, tha cunnart ann gun dèid slighe aiseig ’na bhealach cumhang dhan eaconamaidh agad. Feuch an tog thu grunn dhiubh ri taobh càch a chèile airson an t-eallach a chom-pàirteachadh. Mura gabh sin a dhèanamh, dh’fhaodte gum bi e nas èifeachdaiche gun a bhith a’ cleachdadh slighe aiseig.

source: ‘The Citadel of Adlen surely is the finest masterpiece of Barbarian craftsmanship. Nothing as strong and big and beautiful has ever been built in such a short time.’
target: “Chìthear sàr-cheàrd nan Tùsanach ann am baile daingeann Adlain. Cha deach càil cho mòr treun bòidheach a thogail is cho luath a-riamh.”

source:
Colintan, chief planner of the Citadel of Adlen,
at its opening ceremony
target:
Caileantan, prìomh phlanaigear baile Adlain,
aig deas-ghnàth fhosglaidh

source: Welcome to the beautiful isle of Langeness! I am Reebaud, the chieftain of this pristine island.
target: Fàilte gu eilean Langeness àlainn! Is mise Reebaud, ceann-cinnidh an eilein ùir seo.

source: The ores have to be smelted at a smelting works before they can be used. The refined materials are then used in the weapon smithy, the armor smithy and the toolsmithy.
target: Feumaidh tu na clachan-mèinnir a leaghadh ann an ceàrdach leaghadair mus urrainn dhut an cleachdadh. Tha a’ mheatailt a gheibh thu asta ’ga chleachdadh sa cheàrdaichean arm, armachd ’s acainnean an uairsin.

source: It is produced by the smelting works and used to produce weapons and tools in the metal workshop, ax workshop, war mill and helm smithy.
target: Thèid a shaothrachadh leis a’ cheàrdach leaghadair ’s a chleachdadh airson airm is acainnean a dhèanamh sa cheàrdach meatailt, sa cheàrdach thuaghan agus sa cheàrdach chlogaidean.

source: Look Lutius, I have just analyzed our economy somewhat further. I think there might be a problem with our farms. They don’t show any productivity although there is enough space to plant wheat.
target: Nise, a Lutius, tha mi air barrachd sgrùdadh a dhèanamh air an eaconamaidh againn. Saoilidh mi gu bheil duilgheadas aig na tuathanasan againn. Chan eil iad torrach idir ged a tha rùm gu leòr aca airson cruithneachd a chur.

source: Iron veins contain iron ore that can be dug up by iron mines.
target: Tha iarann sa chuisle iarainn seo a ghabhas tochladh le mèinn iarainn.

source: A wooden helmet is a basic piece of equipment for protecting soldiers. It is produced by the dressmaker and used to train soldiers from health level 1 to level 2.
target: ’S e acainn bhunasach a th’ anns a’ chlogaid fhiodha gus na bana-ghaisgich a dhìon. Saothraichidh tu ann an ceàrdach dhreasaichean i is thèid a cleachdadh gus slàinte nan gaisgeach oideachadh o leibheil 1 gu leibheil 2.

source:
‘Fine cloth and jewelry mean nothing to a true Barbarian.
But a noble sail in the wind will please his eyes.’
target: “Is coma le fìor-Thùsanach aodach no usgar ach is fìor thoigh leis seòl uasail sa ghaoth.”

source: Our building infrastructure is finished and I spent some days making sure that everybody is working well together. Now, there are other pressing matters. I called Colionder, my personal cook, before me to get his help with sorting some things out.
target: Tha am bun-structar togail againn coileanta a-nis agus thug mi seachad latha no dhà a’ dèanamh cinnteach gu bheil a h-uile duine ag obair còmhla gu math. Nise, tha cùisean èiginneach eile romhainn. Dh’iarr mi air Colionder, an còcaire pearsanta agam, gun tigeadh e ach am faighinn a chuideachadh le cuid a nithean.

source: May Satul warm you, Jundlina. My name is Opol, and I am the highest weaver of the guild abandoning Atlantis and Lutas with you. I come with sad news indeed: we have no more spidercloth. Not a single piece is to be found in our warehouses. Could you not help the weavers’ guild by arranging the building of a weaving mill and a spider farm? The spiders deliver the finest silk and we will produce the finest spidercloth from it.
target: Gum blàthaicheadh Satul sibh, a Jundlina. Is mise Opol agus tha mi ’nam àrd-bhreabadair aig a’ chomann-cheàrd a dh’fhàg Atlantas agus Lutas còmhla ribh. Thàinig mi le droch-naidheachd dha-rìribh: dh’fhalbh an sìoda oirnn. Chan eil gin dheth air fhàgail sna taighean-stòrais againn. Nach cuidich sibh comann nam breabadair ach an dèid taigh nam beart is rainse dhamhan a thogail? Bheir na damhain deagh shnàth-sìoda mìn dhuinn agus nì sinn an sìoda as snasaile às.

source: May Satul warm you, Jundlina. Have you considered mining for resources in the mountains around us? We are running short of quartz and diamonds for our buildings. Also, we could use more iron, gold and especially coal. If we find an ample supply of those commodities, we could start producing weapons and tools; this would help enormously. Of course, we would need smelters, a weapon smithy, an armor smithy and a toolsmithy. And maybe even more.
target: Gum blàthaicheadh Satul sibh, a Jundlina. An do bheachdaich sibh air mèinnearachd sna beanntan timcheall oirnn idir? Tha na h-èiteagan ’s na daoimeanan a dh’fheumas sinn airson nan togalaichean againn gu bhith ruith oirnn. A bharrachd air sin, feumaidh sinn cur ris na th’ againn de dh’iarann, òr is gu h-àraidh gual. Nan lorgamaid stòras mòr dhiubh, b’ urrainn dhuinn tòiseachadh air airm is acainnean a dhèanamh; ’s e fìor-chuideachadh a bhiodh ann. Gu nàdarra, bhiodh feum againn air leaghadairean, ceàrdach arm, ceàrdach armachd ’s ceàrdach acainnean. Agus a bharrachd, ma dh’fhaoidte.

source: People are complaining about crowded streets and slow transportation. We need to help out our carriers on the roads. I have decided to build a horse farm so that the horses can help with the heavy wares.
target: Tha a’ mhuinntir a’ togail gearrain mu shràidean tranga agus giùlan slaodach. Feumaidh sinn taic a thoirt dha na giùlanairean air na rathaidean. Chuir mi romham stàball a thogail ach an urrainn do na h-eich cuideachadh leis na batharan troma.

source: But they fear that the war around Al’thunran will set an end to this life. Therefore, they have decided to join us, hoping that we can help each other.
target: Ach tha eagal orra gun cuir an cogadh mu Al’tùnran crìoch air an dòigh-bheatha seo. Mar sin, chuir iad romhpa aonachadh rinn, an dòchas gun doireadh sinn taic dha chàch a chèile.

source: As your roads grow longer and your economy bigger, you should make good use of your oxen to help transport wares more quickly.
target: Fhad ’s a tha na rathaidean agad a’ fàs nas fhaide ’s an eaconamaidh agad nas motha, cuir na daimh agad gu feum gus am bathar a ghluasad gu luath.

source: Our mining economy seems to work fine, that is already good news! Anyway, there are still a lot of men and women waiting in our hall to get a task, so they can help our soldiers to prepare for the war to come.
target: Tha coltas gu bheil eaconamaidh nam mèinnean againn ag obair mar bu chòir, seo deagh naidheachd mar-thà! Co-dhiù no co-dheth, tha mòran fhireannach is bhoireannach a’ feitheamh san talla againn gus dleastanas a ghabhail os làimh ach an cuidicheadh iad na saighdearan leis an ullachadh airson a’ chogaidh a tha romhainn.

source: Yes my fellow soldiers, we have done it! We have met all the challenges that were put in front of us. But my heart is still with our home. We shall set sail as soon as possible to help defend the Empire from the Barbarian tribe.
target: Shoirbhich leinn, a chàirdean! Seas sinn an aghaidh nan dùbhlan uile a bha romhainn. Gidheadh, tha an cianalas orm. Bheir sinn an cuan oirnn cho luath ’s a ghabhas ach an dìonamaid ar n-Ìmpireachd an aghaidh treubh nan Tùsanach.

source: In the meantime, it might help to build a charcoal kiln for buffering any mining shortfalls with charcoal. But be careful to ensure a continuous log supply afterwards.
target: San eadar-àm, dh’fhaoidte gum biodh e feumail dhuinn sloc guail-fhiodha a thogail airson cuideachadh leis an easbhaidh. Ach thoir an aire gum bi fiodh gu leòr againn fhathast an uairsin.

source: Ave, Lutius! If you want us to help you, you first have to worship our goddess Vesta. Therefore deliver 35 sheaves of wheat and 15 amphoras of wine to prepare a worthy sacrifice for her.
target: Ave, a Lutius! Ma tha sibh a’ sireadh taic uainne, feumaidh sibh ùrnaigh a dhèanamh dha ’r ban-dia Bheasta. Mar sin, gun cuireadh sibh 35 raoid cruithneachd agus 15 amforaichean de dh’fhìon thugainn ach an ullaicheamaid ìobairt luachmhor.

source: You have completed this mission. You may move on to the next scenario now to help us build a new home, far from the false God’s vengeful reach…
target: Tha thu air am misean seo a choileanadh. Faodaidh tu gluasad air adhart dhan ath-chnàmh-sgeul a-nis ach an cuir thu taic dhuinn le togail na dachaighe ùire, fad air falbh on dia dìoghaltach…

source: This was the last tutorial I had prepared for you. I’ve now taught you everything I know. There are still secrets hidden in this world even I don’t know about. I will now search for a quiet place to spend my sunset years. If you have still questions, the Widelands community will surely help you. You can find it at:
target: Seo an t-oideachadh mu dheireadh a dh’ullaich mi air do shon. Tha mi air a h-uile rud air a bheil mi eòlach a shealltainn dhut. Tha rùn-dìomhair no dhà eile falaichte san t-saoghal seo nach eil fiù ’s mi fhìn eòlach air. Lorgaidh mi àite far a chuireas mi seachad m’ aois. Ma tha ceist no dhà agad fhathast, bheir coimhearsnachd Widelands taic dhut gun teagamh. Lorgaidh tu i air:

target: Nam bu toigh leat taic a thoirt dhuinn leis an eadar-theangachadh, tadhail air %s

source: This rubber tree is fully grown. Lianas can be gathered from it.
target: Tha a’ chraobh-rubair seo air fàs mòr. Gabhaidh eidhnean a bhuain uaipe.

source: This rubber tree is ready for harvesting rubber by a master woodcutter. Other tribes can harvest it for normal logs.
target: Tha a’ chraobh-rubair seo deis ach am buaineadh sàr-bhuaineadair-fiodha rubair uaipe. ’S urrainn do threubhan eile a leagail airson fiodh àbhaisteach.

source:
‘He loves the animals and to breed them
as we love to cook and eat them.’
target:
“Is esan a bhrideas
is sinne a dh’itheas.”

source: We must improve our military capabilities. If there are foes on the island, we have to be prepared when we meet them. We should also enforce the fortification of our borders.
target: Feumaidh sinn cur ri comas an airm againn. Ma tha nàimhdean sam bith san eilean seo, feumaidh sinn ullachadh mus tachair sinn orra. Bu chòir dhuinn na crìochan againn a dhaingneachadh cuideachd.

source: The news that a patrol brought is not good to hear. Our spies tell us that the war tribes still rage in battle, but some of the elder soldiers and tribe leaders seem to grow tired of this senseless war. Kalitath, son of Kun is the first war leader to leave Al’thunran, thus leaving his side weak and vulnerable. As my scouts report, he has set foot on the lower grounds around the capital, securing the outer fortification rings.
target: Thàinig cuairteachain thugam le droch-naidheachd. Tha na brathadairean againn aig innse dhuinn gu bheil na treubhan a’ dol a-mach air a chèile fhathast ach tha cuid dhe na saighdearan nas sine is ceannardan nan treubhan a’ fàs seachd searbh sgìth dhen chogadh gun chiall seo. Is Kalitath MacKuin a’ chiad cheannard cogaidh a dh’fhàg Al’tùnran agus tha a chliathach lag is so-leònta a-nis. A-rèir na dh’innis na brathadairean rium, thàinig e gun talamh ìosal timcheall air a’ chathair-bhaile, a’ dìon cearcallan a-muigh an daingneachaidh.

source: Praise Satul! Ostur, the young ship builder did it. We have three ships – never have I seen sturdier ones – with enough room to carry all of us and some wares too. And this rescue came just in time: Lutas is about to swallow the rest of this island, the water rises faster by the hour. But we can make our escape now and start over in some country farther away…
target: Moladh do Shatul! Chaidh an latha le Ostur, an saor-luinge òg. Tha trì longan againn – chan fhaca mi gin na bu treasa roimhe riamh – le rùm gu leòr annta gus ar muinntir gu lèir agus beagan bhatharan a chur annta. Agus fhuair sinn teasairginn ri deagh-àm: tha Lutas gu bhith slugadh an còrr dhen eilean ’s an cuan ag èiridh nas luaithe gach uair. Ach teichidh sinn a-nis agus gheibh sinn beatha ùr air tìr nas fhaide air falbh…

source: Needs medium-sized fields (barley, wheat, reed, corn or blackroot) or bushes (berry bushes or grapevines) nearby.
target: Feumaidh e achaidhean (eòrna, cruithneachd, coirce no freumhaige) no preasan (preasan dhearcan no crainn-fhìona) ’s meud meadhanach orra am fagas.

source: The hunter-gatherer gets fresh fish and raw meat for the tribe.
target: Gheibh an sealgair ’s cruinniche iasg is sitheann dhan treubh.

source: ‘Miner’s Delight: Pitta bread with fish or meat, comes with one beer.’
target: “Sòlas a’ mhèinneir: aran tur le iasg no sitheann agus leann.”

source: Chieftain Reebaud, I have more bad news. There are almost no fish in the waters nearby. While we can prepare rations using only fruit or bread, soldier training requires lots of smoked meat or fish. The scraps of meat a reindeer farm drops out as a by-product when making fur aren’t enough.
target: A cheannaird Reebauid, tha droch-naidheachd eile agam. ’S gann gu bheil iasg idir san uisge faisg oirnn. Ged as urrainn dhuinn greimeagan a dhèanamh de dhearcan no aran a-mhàin, feumaidh na saighdearan tòrr feòil no iasg-rèiste airson an oideachaidh. Chan fhoghainn am beagan feòla a gheibh sinn o na tuathanasan rèin-fhèidh nuair a nì sinn bian.

source: All I need to be happy is a slice of honey bread with some smoked meat and a beer.
target: Thoir sliseag arain-mheala le feòil no iasg-rèiste dhomh is bith mi cho sona ri bròg.

source: ‘The log cabin was so small that two men could hardly live there. But we were young and carefree. We just relished our freedom and the responsibility as an outpost.’
target: “’S ann gun robh am bothan cho beag nach fhuiricheadh dithis ann ach air èiginn. Ach bha sinn òg is gun dragh oirnn. ’S ann gun robh sinn toilichte mun t-saorsa ’s mun dleastanas a thug an gearastan dhuinn.”

source: In order to use a registered account, you need an account on the Widelands website. Please log in at %s and set an online gaming password on your profile page.
target: Mus cleachd thu cunntas clàraichte, feumaidh tu cunntas fhaighinn air làrach-lìn Widelands. Clàraich a-steach air %s agus suidhich facal-faire geamaireachd air loidhne (Online Gaming Password) air duilleag na pròifil agad.

source: Harvests special trees: ironwood, rubber and balsa.
target: Buainidh i craobhan sònraichte: craobhan cruaidh, rubair agus balsa.

source: Plants special trees: ironwood, rubber and balsa.
target: Cuiridh i craobhan sònraichte: craobhan cruaidh, rubair agus balsa.

source: Balsa wood is an important building material. It is also used to make light armor. Balsa trees are cut by an experienced woodcutter.
target: ’S e stuth togail cudromach ’s a th’ anns an fhiodh-bhalsa. Thèid a chleachdadh airson armachd aotrom cuideachd. Leagaidh sàr-bhuaineadair-fiodha craobhan-balsa.

source: Blackroots are a special kind of root produced at blackroot farms and processed in mills. The Atlanteans like their strong taste and use their flour for making bread.
target: Saothraichidh tu freumhagan ann an tuathanasan fhreumhagan is bheir thu dhan mhuileann iad an uairsin. Is toigh leis na h-Atlantaich am blas làidir is cleachdaidh iad am min gus aran a dhèanamh.

source: Your warriors’ dwelling discovered an aggressor.
target: Mhothaich am fàrdach bhana-ghaisgeach agad dha dh’ionnsaigh.

source: Your warriors’ dwelling is under attack.
target: Tha am fàrdach bhana-ghaisgeach agad fo ionnsaigh.

source: It is smelted out of gold dust by the furnace and used by the dressmaker and for special buildings.
target: Leaghaidh tu à mìrean òir e san fhùirneis agus cleachdaidh an tè-dhreasaichean agus togalaichean sònraichte e.

source: It is produced by the furnace. Tools and weapons are made of iron. It is also used as jewellery for fur garment armor to give it a silver shine.
target: Thèid a shaothrachadh leis an fhùirneis. Nì thu acainnean is airm de dh’iarann. Thèid a cleachdadh cuideachd ’na sgeadachadh air armachd còta-bèin airson dreach reulagach a chur oirre.

source: Only very important things are embellished with gold. It is produced by the furnace and is used to produce better swords and the best helmets. The best armor is also decorated with gold.
target: Cha dèid ach nithean glè chudromach a sgeadachadh le òr. Thèid a shaothrachadh leis an fhùirneis ’s a chleachdadh airson piseach a thoirt air claidheamhan is clogaidean. Thèid an armachd as fheàrr a sgeadachadh le òr cuideachd.

source: They are used in the furnace and the brick kiln and produced by the blacksmithy.
target: Thèid a chleachdadh leis an fhùirneis ’s an àth bhreigichean ’s a shaothrachadh leis a’ cheàrdach gobhainn.

source: Some say that impenetrable lands to the far north scared away even the most courageous settlers and the bravest of the brave warriors. Big and old forests, full of big and predatory game, cut across by wetlands and hills were shrouded in mystery. The ones who had managed to come back mentioned tremendous buildings, decorated with carvings and gold from majestic mountain ranges somewhere amongst the wilderness. Dozens of years after only some crumbly ruins remain of these good old times, covered with moss and trees. Their shapes give only an idea about the craftsmanship of ancient constructors. Nobody knows why they (have) disappeared. Nobody knows why. People say that now nothing is blocking the road to wealth. But many will die pulled apart by wolves, engulfed by swamp… encircled by hostile tribes.
target: Tha cuid ag ràdh gun do chum an tìr dho-inntrig fada tuath fiù ’s an luchd-tuineachaidh ’s na gaisgich as dàna air falbh. ’S e seann choilltean mòra dìomhair a bh’ ann làn bheathaichean sealgair mòra eadar talamh fliuch ’s cnuic. Dh’innseadh an fheadhainn a thill beò às mu thogalaichean mòra le sgeadachadh snaidhte ’s òir orra agus gun dàinig an t-òr à monaidhean àite air choireigin san fhàsach. Bliadhnaichean mòra às dèidh seo, chan eil ach fuighill còmhdaichte le còinneach ’s craobhan air fhàgail dhen bheatha mhath a b’ àbhaist a bhith ann. Cha doir an cruthan ach beachd farsaing dhut mu cheàird an luchd-togail àrsaidh. Chan eil fios aig duine carson a dh’fhalbh iad. Chan eil fios aig duine carson. Thathar ag ràdh nach eil dad a’ bacadh an rathad dhan bheairteas a-nis. Ach gheibh mòran dhiubh bàs air an reubadh le madaidhean-allaidh, air an dol fodha ann am boglach… le treubhan nàimhdeil timcheall orra.

target: Tuineachadh nam fògarrach

target: Tuineachadh nam fògarrach

source: On this island, we will start our new life. We will build up an outpost for our exile, which perhaps will become a new, beautiful home for every one of us.
target: ’S ann san eilean seo a thòisicheas sinn air ar beatha ùr. Togaidh sinn tuineachadh nam fògarrach a thèid ’na dhachaigh àlainn ùr airson gach fear dhuinn, ma dh’fhaoidte.

source: On this island, we will start our new life. We will build up an outpost for our exile, which perhaps will become a new, beautiful home for every one of us.
target: ’S ann san eilean seo a thòisicheas sinn air ar beatha ùr. Togaidh sinn tuineachadh nam fògarrach a thèid ’na dhachaigh àlainn ùr airson gach fear dhuinn, ma dh’fhaoidte.

source: In this case, Reebaude, I must inform you of the presence of an inhospitable, hostile tribe of barbarians in the vicinity of this very outpost of the Empire.
target: Mas e sin mar a tha cùisean leibh, a Reebauid, feumaidh mi innse dhut gu bheil treubh mosach nàimhdeil de Thùsanaich a’ fuireach faisg air iomall na h-Ìmpireachd seo.

source: And if your waterways present a significant shortcut between your road networks, your economy will tend to send many wares over the waterway. As a waterway can hold only one ferry – unlike roads, which receive a second carrier if they are very busy –, and as they often tend to be rather longer than the two or three fields recommended for roads, there is always a risk of waterways becoming severe bottlenecks in your economy. Try to build several of them in parallel to distribute the strain. If this is not possible, it is in some cases even more efficient not to use waterways.
target: Agus ma bhios na slighean aiseig agad mòran nas giorra na na rathaidean agad, cuiridh an eaconamaidh tòrr bhatharan tromhpa. Air sgàth ’s nach eil ach aon bhàta-aiseig aig gach slighe aiseig – eucoltach ri rathaidean aig a bheil dithis ma tha iad glè thrang – agus on a bhios iad a’ sìneadh nas fhaide eadar nam bratach na bhios rathaidean mar as trice, tha cunnart ann gun dèid slighe aiseig ’na bhealach cumhang dhan eaconamaidh agad. Feuch an tog thu grunn dhiubh ri taobh càch a chèile airson an t-eallach a chom-pàirteachadh. Mura gabh sin a dhèanamh, dh’fhaodte gum bi e nas èifeachdaiche gun a bhith a’ cleachdadh slighe aiseig.

source: Begin or load a single-player campaign or free game
target: Tòisich no luchdaich geama no cnàmh-sgeul aon chluicheadair

source: Besides bread and meat, fish is also a foodstuff for the Empire. Fish are used in taverns, inns and training sites (arena, colosseum, training camp).
target: A bharrachd air aran is feòil, is na h-èisg biadh eile airson na h-Ìmpireachd. Cleachdaidh na taighean-tàirn, taighean-òil is ionadan–oideachaidh (raointean spòrs, coileasaman is campaichean oideachaidh) iad.

source: Of course, it is dark and cold in such depths and only a few venture voluntarily into these places. We should reward this bravery with greater rations for them. And a pint of beer or two will keep their spirits high.
target: Gu nàdarra, tha doimhne dhen leithid dorcha is fuar agus cha dèid mòran ann gu saor-thoileach. Bu chòir dhuinn duais de barrachd bìdh a thoirt dha na daoine dàna ud. Agus bidh iad ann an deagh shunnd ma gheibh iad pinnt no dhà.

source: Man your ship and sail to the horizon.
target: Cruinnich sgioba is seòl dhan aineolach.

source: Praise the gods. We finally have a ship industry.
target: Taing dha na diathan! Bidh loingeas againn a-rithist mu dheireadh thall.

source: The headquarters shipwreck is your main building.
target: ’S e am prìomh thogalach agad a th’ anns an long bhriste seo.

source: ‘I prefer the planks of a ship to any fortress, no matter how strong it is.’
target: “’S fheàrr leam long seach dùn is coma leat dè cho daingean ’s a tha e.”

source: You can try your luck and expand randomly, but this is risky. A safer way is to use a scout to explore unseen parts of the map. What if he finds mountains overflowing with gold?
target: B’ urrainn dhut comhair air thuaiream a thaghadh ach cha bhi sin gun chunnart. Tha e nas sàbhailte rabhadair a chur airson an t-aineol a rùrachadh. Saoil an lorg e beanntan loma-làn òir?

source: I promise you, before the sun sets today you will have a magnificent meal fit for the chieftain of all clans!
target: Bidh biadh math agad a bhios iomchaidh do cheannard nan cinnidhean uile ro dhubhradh na grèine le cinnt!

source: When no cornmeal is required, the mill will try to produce blackroot flour even when there is no demand for it.
target: Mur eil feum air min-choirce, feuchaidh am muilleann ri min-fhreumhaige a shaothrachadh fiù mur eil iarrtas oirre ann.

source: A friend of mine explored the island on his own and he told me of a big lake at the top of the mountain. I suggest we build the ships in this lake and wait until the island drowns beneath us. Then we can sail away. It is a bold plan, but I think it could work.
target: Rùraich caraid agam an t-eilean leis fhèin agus dh’innis e dhomh gu bheil loch mòr air mullach na beinne. Mholainn gun togamaid na longan san loch ud agus gum fan sinn ann gus am bàthaich an t-eilean fodhainn. ’S urrainn dhuinn seòladh air falbh an uairsin. ’S e plana dàna a th’ ann ach saoilidh mi gun obraich e.

source: The traitor left his armies dying where they lay when he saw that he would not keep my forces back. Kalitath disappeared in the confusion of the war, but I don’t care now. Shall he flee and be forgotten for all times as a tribal leader that would not bow before the wooden throne, that is mine to take now.
target: Dh’fhàg an cealgair na daoine aige gus am faigheadh iad bàs far an robh iad ’nan laighe nuair a mhothaich e nach b’ urrainn dha mo chumail air ais. Theich Kalitath ann an ùpraid a’ chogaidh ach tha mi coma a-nis. Gun teicheadh e ’s gun rachadh e a-mach à cuimhne gu bràth mar an ceannard nach gèilleadh fon chathair fhiodha a ghabhas mi fhìn a-nis.

source: Sire, I’ve got good news for you: As I walked to the east, I found a larger mountain. I am not absolutely sure – a geologist should check if I am right – but I believe we could mine marble from some places on the mountain.
target: A thighearna, tha deagh naidheachd agam dhuibh: nuair a choisich mi gu ear, lorg mi beinn mhòr. Chan eil mi buileach cinnteach – bu chòir do chlach-eòlaiche dearbhadh a bheil mi ceart – ach saoilidh mi gum b’ urrainn dhuinn marmor a thogail àiteigin sa bheinn ud.

source: Our wood and reed supplies are ensured. Now, we must take care of our brick supply. Bricks are burned in a brick kiln out of granite and clay, so we first need to produce those. On the mainland, we used to cut granite out of rocks, but I don’t see any here. Perhaps these hills contain enough stones to mine some granite.
target: Tha sinn air dèanamh cinnteach gun dèid fiodh is feur a shaothrachadh. Nise, feumaidh sinn dèiligeadh ri stòras nam breigichean againn. Thèid breigichean a losgadh ann an àth bhreigichean à gaireal is criadh, mar sin feumaidh sinn an dà dhiubh a shaothrachadh an toiseach. Air an tìr-mhòr, b’ àbhaist dhuinn an gaireal a ghearradh à carraigean ach chan fhaic mi gin ann a sheo. ’S dòcha gum bi clach gu leòr sna cnuic seo ach an tochail sinn cuid a ghaireil.

source: We must start by building all the basic buildings. I see no mountains nearby where we might mine coal. We’d better build a charcoal kiln to burn logs into charcoal. We improve the kilns with clay so they don’t consume so much wood. Our neighbors used to envy us for this clever technique, which they couldn’t copy.
target: Feumaidh sinn tòiseachadh leis na togalaichean bunasach. Chan fhaic mi beann far an lorgamaid gual. B’ fheàirrde sinn sloc guail-fhiodha a thogail ach an loisg sinn gual de dh’fhiodh. Cuiridh sinn piseach air na slocan le criadh ach nach fheum iad cus a dh’fhiodh. Chuireadh an dòigh seo am farmad air ar nàbaidhean o nach deach leothasan a cur an cèill.

source: There is one more thing I’d like to teach you now: Expanding your territory. The place that we started with around our headquarters is barely enough for a basic building infrastructure, and we do not have access to mountains, which we need to mine minerals and coal. So, we have to expand our territory.
target: Tha rud ann a bu toigh leam ionnsachadh dhut fhathast: ’s e seo mar a leudaicheas tu an ranntair agad. ’S gann gum foghainn an rùm timcheall air a’ phrìomh-àras a thòisich thu leis airson bun-structair togail bhunasaich is cha ruig sinn na beanntan a dh’fheumas sinn airson mhèinnearach is guail. Seo as adhbhar gum feum sinn an ranntair a th’ againn a leudachadh.

source: Look at this valley here in the far south. We have found a mountain with gold down here and would like to mine ores from it as well. But the streams separating it from our main colony are too wide to build bridges and too narrow for ships to pass them. Our roads would have to take long curves, which slows down ware transport a lot.
target: Seall air a’ gleann seo ceann deas. Lorg sinn beinn le òr innte ann agus bu toigh leinn clach-òir a thochladh uaipe cuideachd. Gidheadh, tha na sruthan a tha ’ga sgaradh on phrìomh-thuineachadh againn ro leathan airson drochaidean a thogail agus ro chaol ach an rachadh long tromhpa. Tha lùban mòra sna rathaidean againn a nì giùlan a’ bhathair uabhasach slaodach.

Also, the ability levels cannot be compared: an Imperial soldier has a base attack of %1% at level 0, while a Barbarian soldier at the same level only has a base attack of %2%.

source: Expeditions can be started in every port. Then, all needed wares are transported to that port. The wares are exactly those your tribe needs to build a port (your goal is to build a port far away from home, so this is not surprising), and of course you need a builder, too. When everything is prepared, a ship will come and pick it up.
target: ’S urrainn dhut triall a thòiseachadh ann am port sam bith. Thèid gach bathar air a bheil feum a ghiùlan dhan phort an uairsin. Tha am bathar air a bheil feum co-ionnann ris na chleachdas do threubh gus port a thogail (bidh fainear dhut port a thogail fad air falbh, mar sin chan eil sin annasach) agus bidh feum agad air fear-togail cuideachd. Nuair a bhios a h-uile rud ullamh, thig long gus a thogail.

source: The farmer working at this cassava plantation has no cleared soil to plant her seeds.
target: Chan eil tìr fosgailte ann ach an cuireadh an tuathanach a tha ag obair aig a’ phlanntachadh casabha seo sìol.
